Author: Alright#0419

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: that happened becuaes of a BUG in the Export TX creation

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you were able to set in the migratecoin script 2 diffrent amounts for export

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: one for the amount that was imported, and another for the amount that was burnt

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this created a condition where shit loads of burnt coins were "left over"

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and went to the miner on the target

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I fixed that, be removing that extra burn amount, and made it simply add all the vouts.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so it cna only burn what is imported ... this is checked on export createion and import validation. All is safe

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
i came across a really simple text to diagram tool when looking for documentation stuff in the last 40-something hours.
```
Bob ->x Alice
Bob -> Alice
Bob ->> Alice
Bob -\ Alice
Bob \\- Alice
Bob //-- Alice

Bob ->o Alice
Bob o\\-- Alice

Bob <-> Alice
Bob <->o Alice
```

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: maybe you guys could use it for your scenarios and abuse?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ok well managed to fix migrates ... I think that was all. Everyone please update to the latest on all your nodes and be on the look out for new or old bugs. I think that wraps up the last of them tbh.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The mining freeze *should* be gone. As should the wallet corruption issues,  if it does happen, we now have some prints on daemon launch and it wont trigger a pointless rescan. With the changes to the staker, using a staking node to make transacions and other things is working well, so people wil be able to stake and test on the same VPS üöÄ

Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator  migrate issues fixed on latest master. You can resume working on your scripts. üòÉ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
My server runs VMWare EXSi on a pair od SDcards ... then has 2x 1TB SSDs RAID1 for mainnet notary VM (with BTC full node) and 2x 512GB SSDs (RAID1) for a seed node VM. Seed runs all nodes, (not BTC) and labs notary... also has a stratum server there if I need to use that. 64GB each VM, 24 cores. 
Then I overprovision testing VMs aswell.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the 128GB of ram running 2xall nodes is starting to run low... but I think I will remove it.

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content: If hardware is too old for ESXi - then proxmox isn't bad - it's what I use on an old twin E5540

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Im using Phenom II's 12 core opterons 2x phenom2 per die.... 4 CPUs it was $1300 with no drives ... added a 600GB HDD for $70 off ebay and the samsung consumer SSDs on the hardware raid... it was a mission to setup and learn... but my a-team parterner @gobi  helped a lot with that, he convinced me to go vmware, when KMD team said bare metal was required .... best idea... that server has been super useful.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: only down side is having to reboot host and delete a file to reset the trial every 60 days.
